did.unittitle: Middle East Institute scrapbook and manuscript collection

physdesc.extent: 4 scrapbooks in phase boxes, 1 manuscript, 1 ballot

did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: This is an artificial collection created for those items in the Middle East Institute rare book collection that were not cataloged with the books. The collection contains scrapbooks with images of the Middle East, one ballot, and one typed manusript. These materials date from 1878-2005.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is an artificial collection created for those items in the Middle East Institute rare book collection that were not cataloged with the books. The collection contains scrapbooks with images of the Middle East, one ballot, and one typed manusript. These materials date from 1878-2005.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: In 2007 the Gelman Library purchased a collection of rare books from the Middle East Institute. These items were among that purchase.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This artificial collection has not beed divided into series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album contains photographs taken by Edward Austin Waters duirng his two year honeymoon with Margaret White Waters. Movies of their trip were bequeathed to the Fogg Museum. Ned Waters was a Captain in the U.S. Army who during World War I worked as a liaison offiver to the Royal Flying Corps.

did.unittitle: Ballot from the 2005 election in Iraq
Arab Cities of the Fertile Crescent

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In the front of the manuscript is a letter from Bert T. King Social Science Analyst Survey Research Division Resaerch and Reference Service to Marcia Strout of the University of Minnesota University Press dated March 13, 1963. Mr. King informs Miss Strout that he has been asked to forward the copy of Dr. Charles Churchill's manuscript. Mr. King also relays that a second copy will be kept with the Survey Research Division long enough for several insterested persons to read it, and then sent on to Miss Strout.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This scrapbook commemorates the voyage of the first oman envoy to the United States in 1840. The emissary Ahmed bin Na'man al Kaabi arrived in New York on April 13, 1840. He was sent by Sayyid Said bin Sultan. The scrapbook primarily contains newspaper articles from 1990 when events were planned to celebrate the 150th anniversary of that historic visit.

did.physdesc: Image of Jerusalem and other sites in Israel. The imges are sepia (color). It appears that perhaps these images were taken from a book.

Black and white, color, and sepia images glued to the album pages. The album is covered in leather that is deteriorating. Many of the images have a number and brief description. It is possible these are purchased images.
